conclusion: Problem involves an ideal gas undergoing a cyclic process ABCDA on a P-V graph.
Cycle is a rectangle on the P-V graph with points A, B, C, D.
Pressures at A and B are P1 and P2; volumes at A and D are V1 and V2.
Temperature at state A is T0; need to find heat exchanged during one cycle.
Identify each process type in the cycle: AB is isochoric, BC is isobaric, CD is isochoric, DA is isobaric.
Use ideal gas law: PV = nRT.
Net heat exchanged (ΔQ) equals net work done (ΔW) for a cyclic process.
For a cycle, internal energy change (ΔU) is zero.
Calculate work done in each process: ΔW_AB = 0, ΔW_BC = P2 * (V2 - V1), ΔW_CD = 0, ΔW_DA = P1 * (V2 - V1).
Net work done: ΔW_total = [P2 + P1] * (V2 - V1).
Net heat added equals net work done.
Verify cycle makes sense with rectangle shape on P-V diagram.
Consider temperatures at each point using ideal gas law.
Calculate temperature at point A: T0 = (P1 * V1) / (nR).
Calculate temperature at point B: TB = (P2 * V1) / (nR).
